newsitem.title: UK: Scientist of 'Dolly' fame joins PPL Therap.
newsitem.headline: Scientist of 'Dolly' fame joins PPL Therap.

text.p: PPL Therapeutics said on Friday that Keith Campbell, the scientist who pioneered the nuclear transfer technology to produce "Dolly the sheep", was joining it from the Roslin Institute.
At PPL, he will oversee the integration of nuclear transfer technology with the company's transgenic programme, particularly in cattle and sheep.

"Keith will work with our research teams both in the UK and in the U.S. to develop the technology further, extending it to other species, such as cattle and pigs, so that we can confidently produce transgenic livestock producing important therapeutic proteins quickly," Alan Colman, research director at PPL, said in a statement.

PPL is a world leader in the production of recombinant proteins using transgenic technology. Successful application of the NT technique would not only increase the efficiency of protein production but may also extend the range of proteins and peptides which can be made this way, it said.
